questions: Q. 1. Which were the two types of demands mentioned by Gandhiji in his letter to Viceroy Irwin on 31 January 1930 ? Why was abolition of ‘Salt tax’ most stirring demand ? Explain.
answers: Ans. The two types of demands mentioned mentioned by Gandhiji in his letter to Viceroy Irwin on 31 January 1930 were :  The reduction of land revenue.  The abolition of salt tax. But abolition of ‘salt tax’ was most stirring demand because Gandhiji knew that salt-tax affected all sections of society, especially the poor. 2 + 1 = 3

questions: Q. 2. How were the untouchables treated in India ? Was it a right attitude ? What was the attitude of Gandhiji towards untouchability or untouchables?
answers: Ans.  Untouchables were not allowed to enter into temple, access to public wells, tanks, roads and schools.  It was not a right attitude.  Gandhiji declared that swaraj would not come for a hundred years if untouchability was not eliminated. He called the untouchables as harijans or children of God. He organized Satyagraha to secure their entry into temples, access to public wells, tanks, roads and schools. He himself cleaned toilets to dignify the work of the sweeper and persuaded upper castes to change their heart and give up the sin of untouchability.

questions: Q. 3. Imaging you are a woman participating in the Civil Disobedience Movement. Explain what the experience meant to your life ?
answers: Ans.  As a woman it was a proud moment for me to participate in Gandhiji’s Civil Disobedience Movement. It was a time when women were kept inside walls.  Though I had got good go od education, I was not allowed to take part in social or political activities. At the call of Gandhiji, I couldn’t resist myself. Revolting against my family traditions, I became an active member of the movement.  I organized the women of m y locality and began the activities of the movement.
